page.title: 09A Cottage Industry Saddlery
page.content: Mr. and Mrs. Travis live in a flat above the bank in Bradninch. They have one child age 7 who attends{Bradninch {School.}Mrs Travis works as a nurse and Mr Travis works as a{saddler.}They have been here since 1982. Mr Travis works from his home making, repairing and selling most of his work in a Wellington shop called "Tack_Care". Mr Travis learnt his trade at London's college for saddlery called Cordwainers. Mr Travis has been working for 20 years. There used to be at least one saddler in every village and town. but there aren't many left now. The last saddler worked in Bradninch 15 years ago. Mr Travis buys ready cured leather. He uses leather from the cow's hindquarter for bridles and from the shoulder for headcollars. Pigskin is used for the saddles.
